result.execSummary:
The defendant Ry Brown Hutchinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ry Brown Hutchinson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ry Brown Hutchinson was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Case should have been a CT that was noted by the Court after plea and sentencing hearing.

10:37 AM Defendant Ry Brown Hutchinson in court.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Andrew T Poole in court for Ry Brown Hutchinson. State recites agreement that defendant to plead to Count 1. Counts 2 and 3 are to be dismissed. For Count 1, 45 days jail with no credit, fine of $1,744 inclusive, 24 month license revocation, 24 month IID and mandatory alcohol assessment. Attorney Poole in agreement. Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1. Attorney Poole stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights he is waiving by his plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered.

Court imposes for Count 1, serve 45 days jail with no credit - huber for work granted, fine of $1,744 inclusive, 24 month license revocation, 24 month IID and mandatory alcohol assessment.

01:46 PM Defendant Ry Brown Hutchinson in court and not in-custody.  Anne Terrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's address updated and amended on complaint. Court recites charges against defendant and possible penalties.  Defendant advised of right to consult an attorney. Defendant indicates that he spoke with counsel in Duluth. Defendant would like some more time to hire counsel. Defendant pleads not guilty. Court accepts plea of not guilty to misdemeanor charge and will set the matter for Status Confernce with Judge Thimm. State requests on bail: $250 cash bail and $2000 signature bond wtih conditions of No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.  No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license.
Defendant does not object to the State's request.  
Court orders $250 cash bond and $2000 signature bond with conditions of  No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.  No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license.
Defendant does indicate he has counsel.  Status conference scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.
